subtitle: Make this cake a few weeks in advance to give it a chance to mature in flavour.

method.text: In a large bowl, mix together the fruit, peel, cherries, almonds, whiskey, lemon and orange rind and juice. Cover and leave at room temperature overnight.
Grease and line the side and base of a 23 cm round cake tin.
Cream together the butter and sugar until pale and fluffy. Gradually beat in the eggs, a little at a time.

Sift together the flour and spice. Fold into the butter mixture, a tablespoon at a time, with the eggs to prevent curdling. Fold in the remaining flour with the macerated fruits and any remaining whiskey.
Spoon the mixture into the prepared cake tin. Bake in the oven for about 1 hour or until a skewer, when inserted in the centre, comes out clean.
Remove from oven. Leave to cool slightly. Then turn out of tin and cool completely on a wire rack. Serve in slices.

title: Irish whiskey cake
